snippet: In the cafeteria at Del Paso Heights Elementary School, the noise rises in a crescendo as students finish their lunches and get ready for recess. Ask them the way to the library and they will point to a locked storage room at the back of the cafet...
lead_paragraph: In the cafeteria at Del Paso Heights Elementary School, the noise rises in a crescendo as students finish their lunches and get ready for recess. Ask them the way to the library and they will point to a locked storage room at the back of the cafeteria that seems better suited to hold surplus peanut butter than books. While that cramped and little-used space is what now serves as a library, at the other end of the school the room that had been the library now houses a third-grade class. A piece of cardboard blocks the old book drop in the door.

headline.main: School Libraries Struggle to Survive in California
